column2: The Culdees are a diverse grouping of monastic and hermit communities, concentrated particularly in Celtic Britain but spread across Western Europe by the many missionaries it produced. Culdean establishments are more familial and decentralized than their Roman counterparts and are well integrated with the secular community, being particularly open to laymen.

The Companions are a diverse grouping of monastic and hermit communities, concentrated particularly in [celtic.GetGroupName] communities but spread widely by the many missionaries it produced. Companion establishments are more familial and decentralized than their [imperiale.GetGroupName] counterparts and are well integrated with the secular community, being particularly open to laymen.
The Conversus of the Culdean Order.

The Community of Saint Lucian is dedicated to a life of piety, personal morality, and ascetism. Members spend their time in scholarship and prayer, and are above all resolutely steadfast in their beliefs and faith, seeking to follow the holy example of Saint Lucian as well as the great teacher Arius.

The Ascetics are dedicated to a life of piety, personal morality, and ascetism. Members spend their time in scholarship and prayer, and are above all resolutely steadfast in their beliefs and faith, seeking to follow the holy example of the great teachers before them.
The Conversus of the Community of Saint Lucian.

The monks of the Brotherhood of the Light live by the laws of Mani set down many centuries ago. They dedicate their lives to fasting and praying as well as writing, singing, and spreading the faith, liberating the light from their bodies and keeping the eternal struggle between the forces of light and dark.

The monks of the Illuminated Ones live by the laws of [manichean.GetHighGodName] set down many centuries ago. They dedicate their lives to fasting and praying as well as writing, singing, and spreading the faith, liberating the light from their bodies and keeping the eternal struggle between the forces of light and dark.
The Conversus of the Brotherhood of the Light.

The Pelagians know that the Lord gave humans the strength and the will to resist temptation and achieve salvation with the divine grace inherited all the way from Adam. So even as temptation abounds for these persecuted Christians to abandon their face and accept their temptation, they hold fast, content in the knowledge that in their hearts, they themselves have the power and the will to go on, until all the people in the world learn Jesus's example and live their holy, sinless life.

Ever since its humble roots, Christians have marked themselves by their refusal to abandon their faith in the face of persecution. So it is that a rich tradition of martyrs and underground parishes can give hope to groups of believers in even the darkest of times, no matter what they are outwardly forced to profess. To each other they can profess their true faith in God, and their God is love.

Arians are no stranger to persecution - first at the hands of the godless pagans, followed by aggressions of the heretical Homoousians, denying the truth of the holy creation of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. The true Christians hold fast to their faith and push on in the spirit of the martyrs before them, and know that soon the truth of the Son and the Father will be apparent to all.

Ever since its humble roots, Christians have marked themselves by their refusal to abandon their faith in the face of persecution. So it is that a rich tradition of martyrs and underground parishes can give hope to groups of believers in even the darkest of times, no matter what they are outwardly forced to profess. To each other they can profess their true faith in God, and their God is love.

The secret pagans of the north are adept at hiding their faith from the worshippers of the dead god on the cross, pretending to exorcise the 'demons' while actually providing sacrifices to what they know are really the sacred places of the nature spirits all around them. They know that, in time, the Queen of Winter and the mother of all will restore the true faithful to their rightful place.

In the sacred groves of the forest and atop the sídhes of the countryside, the secret worshippers of the true gods continue the sacred rituals that have been carried out since time immemorial. They give their offerings to the nature spirits and the aes sídhe, waiting for the day when the Daghda will grant the faithful victory once more.

By day they profess their faith in name though not in heart, while by night they hold vigil to their ancestors and make sacrifices to Wodan, Thunor, and the other gods that rule this world. They hold their faith to the spirits and magic that permeate this world, patiently awaiting the day when the sacred groves can be restored and the ése are openly honoured once more.

By day they profess their faith in name though not in heart, while by night they hold vigil to their ancestors and make sacrifices to Wuodan, Frouwa, and the other gods that rule this world. They hold their faith to the spirits and magic that permeate this world, patiently awaiting the day when the sacred groves can be restored and the Allfader is openly honoured once more.

By day they profess their faith in name though not in heart, while by night they hold vigil to their ancestors and make sacrifices to Wotan, Donar, and the other gods that rule this world. They hold their faith to the spirits and magic that permeate this world, patiently awaiting the day when the sacred groves can be restored and the ensî are openly honoured once more.

By day they profess their faith in name though not in heart, while by night they hold vigil to their ancestors and make sacrifices to Gapt, Teiws, and the other gods that rule this world. They hold their faith to the spirits and magic that permeate this world, patiently awaiting the day when the sacred groves can be restored and the anseis are openly honoured once more.

By day they profess their faith in name though not in heart, while by night they hold vigil to their ancestors and make sacrifices to Agin, Api, and the other gods that rule this world. They hold their faith to the spirits and magic that permeate this world, patiently awaiting the day when the sacred groves can be restored and the true gods are openly honoured once more.

By day they profess their faith in name though not in heart, while by night they hold vigil to their ancestors and make sacrifices to Urtzi, Mari, and the other gods that rule this world. They hold their faith to the spirits and magic that permeate this world, patiently awaiting the day when the sacred groves can be restored and the true gods are openly honoured once more.

For centuries the faith of the people of Greece and Rome was followed by millions. Though the number of adherents has been on a steep decline, those that remain make up for it with their devotion. They deceive the followers of upstart and barbarian gods, though they send their prayers to the Olympians. They have struggled, but the True Hellenes know they will be victorious in the end, because none can stand against the fury of Almighty Jupiter.

For centuries the faith of the people of Greece and Rome was followed by millions. Though the number of adherents has been on a steep decline, those that remain make up for it with their devotion. They deceive the followers of upstart and barbarian gods, though they send their prayers to the Olympians. They have struggled, but the True Hellenes know they that the might of Helios Mithras and the true gods will bring victory in the end.

The secret worshippers of the cult of Sol Invictus may be surrounded by those who deny the eternal divinity of the sun, but the strength of their devotion transcends their foolish false gods. Finding their conviction high up in the sky, in the great orb of light and power that bathes the world in warmth and light, the worshippers of Sol Invictus await the day all shall fear the power of the Unconquered Sun once more.

Only the bravest and most daring men and women deign to join the bands of the Fianna who live on the edge of civilization, hunting and foraging to live off the land and returning to their realms and families only in winter or times of war. Deep in the forest they train and fight, for strength, for righteousness, and for honour.

Only the bravest and most daring men and women deign to join the Warriors of the Forest who live on the edge of civilization, hunting and foraging to live off the land and returning to their realms and families only in winter or times of war. Deep in the forest they train and fight, for strength, for righteousness, and for honour.

The Swords of Agin dedicate their lives to the veneration and worship of the almighty war god. On the fields remniscient of the open steppe of the homeland they hunt and ride, becoming one with their horses, their swords, and their arrows, training to be victorious on the battlefield and take the sacrifices that he demands.

The Swords of Fury dedicate their lives to the veneration and worship of the almighty war god. On the steppes and fields they hunt and ride, becoming one with their horses, their swords, and their arrows, training to be victorious on the battlefield and take the sacrifices that he demands.

By day the Cave Dwellers spend their time hidden away deep in the caves they call home, training and worshipping the gods that live there. Only at night do they come out to fight those that would harm them and their people, doing the will of Mari like the spirits of old.

By day the Cave Dwellers spend their time hidden away deep in the caves they call home, training and worshipping the gods that live there. Only at night do they come out to fight those that would harm them and their people, doing the will of [vasconic_pagan.GetHighGodName] like the spirits of old.
The society has less than §Y10§! members, and you publicly follow [GetWLCanJoinReligion]\n
Has a §YLiege§!, §YVassal§!, or a §Yneighboring ruler§! who follows [GetWLCanJoinReligion]\n

The Wolf Warriors, or Wulfhidanoz as they call themselves, consist of ferocious men and women fighting for honor and recognition on the battlefield, as well as an ideal of bravery and companionship. In honor of Wodan the Allfather, they wear their pelts into battle, and favor a spear in personal combat.
